title: `iOS` build fails after upgrading `react-native` version to `0.69.9`
body:
### Errors seen locally and on CI are below

```log
[React-RCTAnimation] Compiling RCTNativeAnimatedTurboModule.mm
❌ /Users/siddarthkumar/code/experiments/status-mobile/node_modules/react-native/Libraries/
NativeAnimation/RCTNativeAnimatedTurboModule.mm:18:44: cannot find protocol declaration for 
'NativeAnimatedModuleSpec'
@interface RCTNativeAnimatedTurboModule() <NativeAnimatedModuleSpec, RCTInitializing>
                                           ^
❌ /Users/siddarthkumar/code/experiments/status-mobile/node_modules/react-native/Libraries/
NativeAnimation/RCTNativeAnimatedTurboModule.mm:243:33: use of undeclared identifier 'JS'
                  eventMapping:(JS::NativeAnimatedModule::EventMapping &)eventMapping)
                                ^
❌ /Users/siddarthkumar/code/experiments/status-mobile/node_modules/react-native/Libraries/
NativeAnimation/RCTNativeAnimatedTurboModule.mm:243:33: expected a type
/Users/siddarthkumar/code/experiments/status-mobile/node_modules/react-native/Libraries/
NativeAnimation/RCTNativeAnimatedTurboModule.mm:360:37: error: no member 
named 'TurboModule' in namespace 'facebook::react'
- (std::shared_ptr<facebook::react::TurboModule>)getTurboModule:
(const facebook::react::ObjCTurboModule::InitParams &)params
❌ /Users/siddarthkumar/code/experiments/status-mobile/node_modules/react-native/Libraries/
NativeAnimation/RCTNativeAnimatedTurboModule.mm:360:89: no member named 
'ObjCTurboModule' in namespace 'facebook::react'
- (std::shared_ptr<facebook::react::TurboModule>)getTurboModule:
(const facebook::react::ObjCTurboModule::InitParams &)params
                                                                       ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^
❌ /Users/siddarthkumar/code/experiments/status-mobile/node_modules/react-native/Libraries/
NativeAnimation/RCTNativeAnimatedTurboModule.mm:246:76: property 'nativeEventPath' not found 
on object of type '__strong id'
  eventMappingDict[@"nativeEventPath"] = RCTConvertVecToArray(eventMapping.nativeEventPath());
                                                                           ^
❌ /Users/siddarthkumar/code/experiments/status-mobile/node_modules/react-native/Libraries/
NativeAnimation/RCTNativeAnimatedTurboModule.mm:248:20: property 'animatedValueTag' not found 
on object of type '__strong id'
  if (eventMapping.animatedValueTag()) {
                   ^
❌ /Users/siddarthkumar/code/experiments/status-mobile/node_modules/react-native/Libraries/
NativeAnimation/RCTNativeAnimatedTurboModule.mm:249:61: property 'animatedValueTag' not found on 
object of type '__strong id'
    eventMappingDict[@"animatedValueTag"] = @(*eventMapping.animatedValueTag());
                                                            ^
[React-RCTAnimation] Compiling RCTNativeAnimatedNodesManager.m
[React-RCTAnimation] Compiling RCTNativeAnimatedModule.mm
❌ /Users/siddarthkumar/code/experiments/status-mobile/node_modules/react-native/Libraries/
NativeAnimation/RCTNativeAnimatedModule.mm:232:33: use of undeclared identifier 'JS'
                  eventMapping:(JS::NativeAnimatedModule::EventMapping &)eventMapping)
                                ^
❌ /Users/siddarthkumar/code/experiments/status-mobile/node_modules/react-native/Libraries/
NativeAnimation/RCTNativeAnimatedModule.mm:232:33: expected a type
/Users/siddarthkumar/code/experiments/status-mobile/node_modules/react-native/Libraries/
NativeAnimation/RCTNativeAnimatedModule.mm:235:76: error: property 'nativeEventPath' not found 
on object of type '__strong id'
  eventMappingDict[@"nativeEventPath"] = RCTConvertVecToArray(eventMapping.nativeEventPath());
❌ /Users/siddarthkumar/code/experiments/status-mobile/node_modules/react-native/Libraries/
NativeAnimation/RCTNativeAnimatedModule.mm:237:20: property 'animatedValueTag' not found on 
object of type '__strong id'
  if (eventMapping.animatedValueTag()) {
                   ^
❌ /Users/siddarthkumar/code/experiments/status-mobile/node_modules/react-native/Libraries/
NativeAnimation/RCTNativeAnimatedModule.mm:238:61: property 'animatedValueTag' not found on 
object of type '__strong id'
    eventMappingDict[@"animatedValueTag"] = @(*eventMapping.animatedValueTag());
```

Errors are automagically fixed when i open Xcode and do a rebuild from it. Unfortunately this is not an option on our Jenkins CI.
We need to figure out a deterministic way of making this build work. Perhaps Xcode does something that `xcodebuild` from CI does not do.

I have created this issue to log my findings and to figure our a solution.

#blocks : https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/pull/15645

### Additional Information
- Operating System: iOS
We're not the only ones that face this issue : https://github.com/nrwl/nx/issues/15620#issuecomment-1508475633

So i do a little experiment 

```log
siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % 
find node_modules -type f -exec md5 {} \; | sort | md5 > before_checksum.txt

siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % 
find node_modules -type f -exec md5 {} \; | sort | md5 > after_checksum.txt

siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % 
diff before_checksum.txt after_checksum.txt

1c1
< 78725f020c21a097906ede1f8a7b57a0
---
> e82e00386dca8e4ca6e91624a69c1dfd

```

I make a checksum of `node_modules` before I build via `Xcode` and I repeat the same process after building from `Xcode` (the build succeeds via `Xcode`)
And obviously `node_modules` has changed.
**Xcode is the culprit.**

Time to figure out why..

Wow this is probably nothing: this is an auto generated file which changes on each build. so the change here is harmless. 

```log
siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % 
find node_modules -type f -exec md5 {} \; | sort > before_files.txt

siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % 
find node_modules -type f -exec md5 {} \; | sort > after_files.txt 

siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % 
diff before_files.txt after_files.txt
50025c50025
< MD5 (node_modules/react-native-config/ios/ReactNativeConfig/GeneratedDotEnv.m) 
= 1ab7753c34e3c88a4987ee30fe8308fb
---
> MD5 (node_modules/react-native-config/ios/ReactNativeConfig/GeneratedDotEnv.m) 
= b5c74a5d3eaa68b93343879c2c6a0ab9

```

I will investigate changes to `ios/build/generated` next.

Some interesting findings : 

```log
siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % find ios/build -type f -exec md5 {} \; | sort > before_files.txt
siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % find ios/build -type f -exec md5 {} \; | sort > after_files.txt
siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % diff before_files.txt after_files.txt
1,2c1,2
< MD5 (ios/build/generated/ios/FBReactNativeSpec/FBReactNativeSpec-generated.mm) = d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e
< MD5 (ios/build/generated/ios/FBReactNativeSpec/FBReactNativeSpec.h) = d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e
---
> MD5 (ios/build/generated/ios/FBReactNativeSpec/FBReactNativeSpec-generated.mm) = 2e330c2f56d29e87f8b9affe419b44a5
> MD5 (ios/build/generated/ios/FBReactNativeSpec/FBReactNativeSpec.h) = a053a3f7791da5883faeb869b1c6195e
```
Also `FBReactNativeSpec.h` contains this code after we ran a build from Xcode : 
`@protocol NativeAnimatedModuleSpec <RCTBridgeModule, RCTTurboModule>`
`NativeAnimatedModuleSpec` is the protocol declaration that the error was originally complaining about 🤔

Also before I run build from Xcode both these files are empty : 
- `ios/build/generated/ios/FBReactNativeSpec/FBReactNativeSpec-generated.mm`
- `ios/build/generated/ios/FBReactNativeSpec/FBReactNativeSpec.h` 

Which is likely the issue, nothing a nix patch can't fix :)

This is a great catch. Using checksums to identify what changes was a good idea.

Hopefully we can find a script in `react-native` module that we can patch to fix this behavior.

To get `node_modules/react-native/scripts/generate-artifacts.js` to do its job I have to make sure this flag is set while doing pod install `ENV['USE_CODEGEN_DISCOVERY'] =1`
and when i do that the codegen does its job and I get the files i need in :
- `ios/build/generated/ios/FBReactNativeSpec/FBReactNativeSpec-generated.mm`
- `ios/build/generated/ios/FBReactNativeSpec/FBReactNativeSpec.h`

So this is a much better solution than making a patch 🥳😁
